comment: The old dangers of over charging are no longer present...but if you keep your phone on a charger for days and days on end then the battery has a chance of swelling from not discharging more than a percent or two. This is extremely unlikely though. The only reason you'd need to discharge a battery fully is to reset the metaphorical "counter" on the percentage meter so it's more accurate...but it has no real effect on the battery capacity or life itself.

comment: If your charging any modern battery the only one you would need to worry about is a lithium battery. But if it's built in a product (like a phone or PC) your fine. It would only be a problem if the battery was directly plugged into the wall.So no, your fine.
